titlestmt.titleproper: Letter from Sergeant James E. Derwent to Charles Fellows, Regarding the Death of Cochise 1874
Letter from Sergeant James E. Derwent to Charles Fellows, Regarding the Death of Cochise

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Letter from Sergeant James E. Derwent to Charles Fellows, Regarding the Death of Cochise 1874
did.abstract: James E. Derwent , Sargeant in Company D, 5th United States Cavalry, was on the Chiracahua reservation when Cochise died. Charles Fellows was a personal friend of the sergeant. Holograph letter, accompanied by original envelope.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Letter from Sergeant James E. Derwent to Charles Fellows, Regarding the Death of Cochise (AZ 322). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired as gift of David R. Ewing, 1968.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Sergeant Derwent, Company D, 5th United States Cavalry, was on the Chiracahua reservation when Cochise died. Charles Fellows was a personal friend of the sergeant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Holograph letter, accompanied by original envelope.

relatedmaterial.p: Published with historical note by Russell C. Ewing, in Arizona and the West, v.11, no. 1, Spring 1969.
